metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data of Quemocuo carbonate rocks in Sanjiang Tethys belt
metadata.description: The data are SM Nd isotopic data of calcite, in-situ S isotopic data of sulfide, in-situ Pb isotopic data of pyrite and galena, and Rb SR isochron age data of Quemocuo carbonate in Sanjiang Tethys belt. SM Nd isotopic data of calcite were obtained by ICP-MS, S isotopic data of sulfide and Pb isotopic data of pyrite and galena were obtained by MC-ICP-MS, and Rb Sr isotopic data were obtained by ICP-MS. The above data have been published in high-level SCI journals, and the data are true and reliable. The obtained data are of great significance to the lead-zinc mineralization and prospecting in the Sanjiang lead-zinc metallogenic belt.
metadata.instructions: The geochemical data are stored in word format, and the sample name is "YY DD", where YY is the borehole number and DD is the abbreviation of mineral

authorList.unitEn: University of Science and Technology of China

Verification.Question: Does the data collection method for Sm-Nd isotopes in calcite utilize ICP-MS analysis?

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to obtain geochemical data from carbonate rocks in the Sanjiang Tethys region?
Example.Answer: One data collection method involves using ICP-MS analysis to obtain calcite Sm-Nd isotope data. Additionally, MC-ICP-MS analysis is employed to gather in-situ sulfur isotope data from sulfides, as well as in-situ lead isotope data from pyrite and galena. Rb-Sr isotopic data are also collected using ICP-MS analysis.

Definition.Question: What does 'Sm-Nd isotope data obtained by ICP-MS analysis' mean in the context of geochemical studies of carbonate rocks?
Definition.Answer: In the context of geochemical studies of carbonate rocks, 'Sm-Nd isotope data obtained by ICP-MS analysis' refers to data collected on the isotopic composition of samarium (Sm) and neodymium (Nd) within calcite minerals using Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS). This technique involves the ionization of sample materials with an inductively coupled plasma source and the separation of ions based on their mass-to-charge ratio to measure isotopic ratios. This data is crucial for understanding the geochemical history and sources of materials within the rocks.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the instrumental techniques utilized to obtain Sm-Nd, S, and Pb isotopic data from carbonate rocks and sulfide minerals, and what challenges might arise during this data collection process?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The Sm-Nd isotopic data from carbonate rocks are obtained using ICP-MS analysis. Sulfide minerals' in-situ S isotopic data and in-situ Pb isotopic data from pyrite and galena are obtained using MC-ICP-MS analysis. Challenges in this data collection process may include ensuring the precision and accuracy of isotopic measurements, dealing with potential contamination, and the calibration of instruments for accurate isotope ratio determination.
